meanings.definition: To insert or establish something firmly within something else.
meanings.sent1: She carefully ingrafts the new idea into her mind.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon ingrafts the donated organ into the patient's body.
meanings.sent3: The teacher ingrafts the love for learning in her students.
meanings.sent4: He ingrafts his passion for music into every note he plays.
meanings.sent5: The gardener ingrafts the young sapling into the soil, ensuring its growth.

meanings.definition: To incorporate or implant something into something else.
meanings.sent1: The chef ingrafts the secret ingredient into the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The company ingrafts new technology into their operations.
meanings.sent3: The artist ingrafts creativity into every stroke of the brush.
meanings.sent4: She ingrafts kindness into every interaction she has.
meanings.sent5: The writer ingrafts emotion into every word of the story.
